main.name: Assets
main.description: `Game.assets` makes it easy to download and organize assets that are needed for your game. When the first Game is created on the page, a `<div>` with id `2D-loaders` will be added at the bottom of the DOM. Each game will place a `<div>` with class `2D-loader` inside that `<div>`. With `Game.Assets.load()`, the appropriate element will be placed inside the respective `2D-loader` `<div>`.

children.name: load
children.description: Load the given file or the file at the given URL. Optionally specify a name to refer to it later. All loaded assets can always be retrieved based on their URL or their optional name.

arguments.name: URL
arguments.description: The URL of the file to download. The URL will be passed directly to the XHR request.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: An optional, unique name to easily retrieve the file later on.

children.name: get
children.description: Get the file with the given name or URL. If no identifier is given, Assets will return the last added asset. The file must already be loaded with `Assets.load()`.

arguments.name: URL/name
arguments.description: The name or URL of the file to get.

children.name: errors
children.description: The amount of assets that have encountered an error while loading.

children.name: total
children.description: The total amount of assets saved in this plugin. Same as `.assets.length`.
